@description.name: @description
@description.body: Characters allowed in a Base 64 encoded string

@param.name: @param
@param.body: input {String} the input string to encode

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
is8bit {Boolean?} Whether the character set is 8-bit, not
   multi-byte.  If this parameter is not provided, the character set is
   determined from the 'document' object.
@param.description:
Whether the character set is 8-bit, not
   multi-byte.  If this parameter is not provided, the character set is
   determined from the 'document' object.

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Adds to output array the UTF-8 bytes needed to represent the character (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF8)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: characterCode {Integer} the code of the character

@param.name: @param
@param.body: output {Array} the array of bytes to be filled
@param.description: the array of bytes to be filled

@param.name: @param
@param.body: is8bit {Boolean} specifies whether we should not treat the array as a multi byte string
@param.description: specifies whether we should not treat the array as a multi byte string

@description.name: @description
@description.body: Returns a String from an array of bytes, with special treatment if the bytes are UTF-8 bytes (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UTF8)

@param.name: @param
@param.body: is8bit {Boolean} specifies whether we should not treat the array as a multi byte string
@param.description: specifies whether we should not treat the array as a multi byte string

@return.name: @return
@return.body: {String} the string backed by the byte array
@return.description: the string backed by the byte array

@param.name: @param
@param.body: input {String} the input string to decode

@param.name: @param
@param.body:
is8bit {Boolean?} Whether the character set is 8-bit, not
   multi-byte.  If this parameter is not provided, the character set is
   determined from the 'document' object.
@param.description:
Whether the character set is 8-bit, not
   multi-byte.  If this parameter is not provided, the character set is
   determined from the 'document' object.
